tweets.text: I expect we will get into a protracted discussion with the @EnvAgency over what causes theses sewage discharges on the @RiverChess, they know the problem and I know the problem is so lets hope they do not waste my time or insult my intelligence with their usual arguments.

The community the live near Bois Mill on the @RiverChess tell us not only highly discoloured but smell was terrible, the worst they remember. The @EnvAgency need to note this has nothing to do with storm events, no rain yesterday, this is entirely due to groundwater ingress. https://t.co/zPThbWUdBw

Need accurate & honest information on @RiverChess sewage discharges, without this @EnvAgency will never solve these issues. Hope you are listening @JamesBevanEA you still owe the Public Account  Committee a correction to your correction about sewage discharges into Chalkstreams.

The @EnvAgency need to understand that groundwater ingress is an un-permitted reason to discharge untreated sewage. We hope the local residents impacted by these discharges are compensated for having to live with these daily events, has happened continuously since the 22nd Jan.

Mattresses. Sofas. Duvets. Industrial fridges. Bags and bags of plastic. From the River Crane. Decided to take action after authorities failed the environment. @FriendsRivCrane @GuyLambert @CVP_CraneValley @CanLager @HestonActionG @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @LlangattockPick https://t.co/loCt8HiweY

urls.title: Get a personal wellbeing report free via your smart phone | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: Do you feel happier when you‚Äôre in green space? Does listening to birdsong lift your spirits? We‚Äôre launching our largest ever citizen science project to record the benefits of being beside water, and we‚Äôd like you to join in as well.

tweets.text: Well. Well! Well? #CitizenScience project @CanalRiverTrust is seeking volunteers to monitor how being by water affects wellbeing using the #UrbanMind app HT @EnvAgency  https://t.co/Z76PrnYnK9

urls.title: Overflowing sorting hall sees Viridor facing health complaints
urls.description: Shocking photographs taken from inside the sorting hall at the Viridor-operated incinerator at Beddington Lane show overflowing piles of rubbish with clinical waste sacks mixed with general househo‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Overflowing sorting hall sees Viridor facing health complaints https://t.co/WKbyUrQbqG via @InsideCroydon the so called government patsies and government friends of @scottishepa @EnvAgency and funny enough another EFW burning clinical waste illegally #corrupt

Keeping our Welsh Harp clean is a responsibility we all share. We are so grateful to our volunteers who contribute every day to reduce the high level of waste generated by years of neglect. 
@EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust we must all play our part #cleantheharp https://t.co/eYHE85T20g

Fountains of sewage spurting from access chambers on Clifton Ings SSSI today. A regular occurrence when river levels are high, as has been pointed out many, many times to @EnvAgencyYNE, @NEYorksNLincs, @YorkshireWater. 
This is discharge pipe from Rawcliffe STW to River Ouse. https://t.co/2fWesgc9ow

@Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil I'll get our local team to make contact with you. The volunteers are certainly helping, but you might know #WelshHarp is owned by the @CRTSouthEast. Any other landowner is responsible for maintaining the river area, such as banks and vegetation to control flood-risk. Peter

Thank you @TheParksTrust, @EnvAgencySE & @AnglianWater for this interesting article on #MiltonKeynes' flood defences. How long do you think the balancing lakes etc will suffice as the climate changes? https://t.co/1BRgm6OGFQ

@EnvAgencySE @BarnetCouncil @CRTSouthEast Thanks. The trash traps need looking at as this happens close by. Litter is obv an issue but the extent of the fly-tipping of large items in the wider area is almost unbelievable. A joined-up approach of collective responsibility and action is long overdue. https://t.co/5B277sIMyS

@Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil Worth saying, Sara, we regularly clear the two trash screens we manage on the edge of #WelshHarp, due to the amount of rubbish they collect. Some online myths about Welsh Harp, incl: ‚ÄúEA's not doing anything.‚Äù People not dropping litter would also help, of course. Peter

Incredible community effort going on but @BarnetCouncil and @EnvAgencySE urgently need to step up here.  Also please stay safe - look for the signs that show areas not to walk on. https://t.co/IaEZ0Efx4b

@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids This is getting horrendous I‚Äôm sat in the living room with doors and windows shut and the smell of the landfill is disgusting yet another night of no sleep. I use a CPAP machine to sleep which makes it even worse t lingers in the tubing not good for my health ü§Æ
